MenuItem.title: MenuItem
MenuItem.description: A single menu item available for ordering.

_id.description: Unique identifier of the menu item

description.example: Classic pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil

price.description: Price in minor currency or standard units, depending on system

isAvailable.description: Whether the item is currently available

MenuResponse.description: Response containing a list of menu items.

success.description: Indicates if the request was successful

Title: Getting Started with QR-Based Restaurant Management System API

Nodes.Text: API for browsing menu items and placing orders in a QR-based restaurant system.
Install the SDK by adding the following dependency in your project's pom.xml file:

You can also view the package at:
https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/com.apimatic/sample-sdk-artifact-id/1.0.0
The following parameters are configurable for the API Client:

Data: Set up Http Client Configuration instance.
The Credentials Setter for OAuth 2 Bearer token

Nodes.Text: The API client can be initialized as follows:

This API uses the following authentication schemes.
* [`bearerAuth (OAuth 2 Bearer token)`]($h/__auth_BearerAuth)
Documentation for accessing and setting credentials for bearerAuth.

Data: The OAuth 2.0 Access Token to use for API requests.

Nodes.Text: **Note:** Auth credentials can be set using `bearerAuthCredentials` in the client builder and accessed through `getBearerAuthCredentials` method in the client instance.
You must provide credentials in the client as shown in the following code snippet.
This page can contain Tutorials/Guides/Changelogs or any information that API providers want to expose to their users besides what is auto-generated by Apimatic.
An instance of the `MenuApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.

Nodes.Title: List Menu Items
Nodes.Name: listMenuItemsAsync
Nodes.Description: Returns the full list of menu items currently available for ordering.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `getResult()` getter of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```MenuResponse```]($m/MenuResponse).

ReturnTypeExample.Text:
{
  "success": true,
  "count": 2,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0001",
      "name": "Margherita Pizza",
      "description": "Classic pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil",
      "price": 1199.0,
      "category": "Pizza",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/margherita.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    },
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0002",
      "name": "Chicken Biryani",
      "description": "Spiced rice with marinated chicken",
      "price": 899.0,
      "category": "Main",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/biryani.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    }
  ]
}

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"GET","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/menu{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json"{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"none"}}

Response.Name: response200
Response.Description:
List of menu items

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `getResult()` getter of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```MenuResponse```]($m/MenuResponse).

Example.Text:
{
  "success": true,
  "count": 2,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0001",
      "name": "Margherita Pizza",
      "description": "Classic pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil",
      "price": 1199.0,
      "category": "Pizza",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/margherita.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    },
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0002",
      "name": "Chicken Biryani",
      "description": "Spiced rice with marinated chicken",
      "price": 899.0,
      "category": "Main",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/biryani.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    }
  ]
}

Nodes.Text: Endpoints for creating and viewing orders
An instance of the `OrderApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.

Nodes.Title: Place Order
Nodes.Name: placeOrderAsync
Nodes.Description: Creates an order for the specified items and table.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `getResult()` getter of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderResponse```]($m/OrderResponse).

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Order payload including items, table number, and customer details.

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"POST","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/order/place-order{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json","Content-Type":"application/json"{% if auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] != nil %},"Authorization":{{ auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] | prepend: 'Bearer ' | json: false }}{% endif %}{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"json","data":{% if call["args"]["body"] != nil %}{{ call["args"]["body"] | unwrap_add_props | json: false }}{% else %}null{% endif %}}}

Response.Name: response201
Response.Description:
Order placed successfully

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `getResult()` getter of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderResponse```]($m/OrderResponse).

Headers.Name: Location
Headers.Description: URL of the created order resource

Nodes.Title: Get Order History
Nodes.Name: getOrderHistoryAsync
Nodes.Description: Returns the authenticated user's recent orders.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `getResult()` getter of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderHistoryResponse```]($m/OrderHistoryResponse).

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"GET","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/order/history{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json"{% if auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] != nil %},"Authorization":{{ auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] | prepend: 'Bearer ' | json: false }}{% endif %}{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"none"}}

Response.Name: response200
Response.Description:
List of previous orders

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `getResult()` getter of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderHistoryResponse```]($m/OrderHistoryResponse).

Data: Getter for the masking sensitive headers flag.
Converts this ApiLoggingConfiguration into string format.
Builds a new ApiLoggingConfiguration.Builder object. Creates the instance with the current state.

Nodes.Text: Class to build instances of ApiLoggingConfiguration.

Data: Default Constructor to initiate builder with default properties.
Set level for logging. Default level is INFO. Other available levels are `ERROR`, `WARN`, `DEBUG`, and `TRACE`.
Set Logger for logging. Here you can provide custom slf4j implementation if needed.
Set mask sensitive headers flag. Default value is true.
Builds a new [```ApiLoggingConfiguration```]($h/__additional_documentation/Configuration/ApiLoggingConfiguration) object using the set fields.

Nodes.Text: In order to provide custom logger, any implementation of the logging facade `org.slf4j.Logger` can be used by adding its dependencies to the `pom.xml`.

As we are using `org.apache.logging.log4j` dependency which itself provides its own logging API and implementation using the logging facade `org.slf4j.Logger`. So we would need to create a `log4j2.xml` configuration file and add it to the project's build path.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Configuration>
    <Appenders>
        <Console name="Console" target="SYSTEM_OUT">
            <JsonTemplateLayout eventTemplateUri="classpath:EcsLayout.json"/>
        </Console>
    </Appenders>
    <Loggers>
        <Root level="trace">
            <AppenderRef ref="Console" />
        </Root>
    </Loggers>
</Configuration>
The following example uses the `LoggerFactory.getLogger` to get the underlying log4j implementation from the project's build path for QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiClient initialization.
Class to build instances of RequestLoggingConfiguration.

Data: Default Constructor to initiate builder with default properties.
Sets whether to log the body of the request. Default value is false.
Sets whether to log the headers of the request. Default value is false.
Sets the headers to be excluded from logging.
Sets the headers to be included in logging.
Sets the headers to be unmasked in logging.
Sets whether to include query parameters in the request path. Default value is true.
Constructs a RequestLoggingConfiguration object with the set values.

Nodes.Text: Class to build instances of ResponseLoggingConfiguration.

Data: Default Constructor to initiate builder with default properties.
Sets whether to log the response body. Default value is false.
Sets whether to log the response headers. Default value is false.
Sets the headers to be excluded from logging.
Sets the headers to be included in logging.
Sets the headers to be unmasked in logging.
Constructs a ResponseLoggingConfiguration object with the set values.

Nodes.Text: Class for holding http client configuration.

Data: The timeout in seconds to use for making HTTP requests.
The number of retries to make.
To use in calculation of wait time for next request in case of failure.
To use in calculation of wait time for next request in case of failure.
Http status codes to retry against.
The maximum wait time for overall retrying requests.
Whether to retry on request timeout.
The OkHttpClient instance used to make the HTTP calls.
Allow the SDK to override HTTP client instance's settings used for features like retries, timeouts etc.
The proxy configuration settings used by the HTTP client.
Converts this HttpClientConfiguration into string format.
Builds a new {@link HttpClientConfiguration.Builder} object. Creates the instance with the current state.
Default Constructor to initiate builder with default properties.
Sets the timeout in seconds to use for making http requests.
Sets the number of retries to make.
Sets to use in calculation of wait time for next request in case of failure.
Sets to use in calculation of wait time for next request in case of failure.
Sets http status codes to retry against.
Sets http methods to retry against.
Sets the maximum wait time for overall retrying requests.
Sets whether to retry on request timeout.
Sets the okhttpclient instance used to make the http calls.
Sets the okhttpclient instance used to make the http calls and an option to Allow the SDK to override HTTP client instance's settings used for features like retries, timeouts etc.
Sets the proxy configuration for the underlying HTTP client.
Builds a new HttpClientConfiguration object using the set fields.

Nodes.Text: To configure the SDK to use a proxy server, initialize the proxy configuration during client setup as shown in the Usage Example.
Class for creating and managing HTTP Headers.

Data: Constructor that creates a new instance using a given Map.
Use to check if the given name is present in headers.
Returns a Set containing all header names.
Returns the first value associated with a given header name, or null if the header name is not found.
Returns a List of all values associated with a given header name, or null if the header name is not found.
Returns a Map of the headers, giving only one value for each header name.
Returns a simulated MultiMap of the headers.
Adds a value for a header name to this object.
Adds a List of values for a header name to this object.
Adds values from a Map to this object.
Adds values from a simulated Multi-Map to this object.
Adds all the entries in a Headers object to this object.
Removes the mapping for a header name if it is present.
